name: rusted longsword
description: An old and rusted longsword that has seen better days. Perhaps it could be reforged into something better if you or someone else had the skills.

name: moldy wooden sword
description: A wooden sword most likely played with by a child at some point. This one is old and the wood rot has already taken hold.

name: rusted sharp spike
description: A spike of metal that seems to have had some semblance of a cutting edge at some point. Whatever it was before, it is now merely a rusted spike.

name: rusted baselard
description: An baselard that looks like it was unearthed from some someone's weathered grave. Although rusted, it still serves its function surprisingly well.

name: rusted machete
description: A machete that's been someone's choice of cutting tool for a very long time but wasn't ever taken care of. It's lost most of what makes it a good cutter but can still perform the job if it needs to.

name: rusted cavalry sabre
description: A cavalry sabre. What little remains of this once noble weapon is nothing to be proud of. No shine or proper cutting edge, just the grimy rust from ages of neglect.

name: rusted kirs
description: There is little left if what defines this blade as a kris. Simply a seemingly mangled rusted knife now.

name: rusted kukri
description: Looking at it now, one would never have guessed this kukri was once a serviceable weapon. Now it just looks like the thrown-away project of a failed blacksmith's apprentice.

name: rusted jian
description: From a far off land this weapon has come. However it got here it doesn't look like its rusted blade or its seemingly once-ornate guard has survived the test of time.

name: rusted jian
description: From a far off land this weapon has come. However it got here it doesn't look like its rusted blade or its seemingly once-ornate guard has survived the test of time.

name: rusted scimitar
description: A rusted scimitar. Had it stayed in its homeland it would've probably still been an alright weapon. Unfortunately now it's just about as useful as any other severely weathered blade.

name: rusted estoc
description: A neglected estoc, once a great weapon, now just a shadow of its former self. You can't imagine it ever being as good as it was again.

name: rusted arming sword
description: An arming sword without shine or hope. While you'd still be considered armed with this there aren't many that would take you seriously.

name: rusted tanto
description: A single-edged short rusted blade from a far land. It would've probably been able to cut pretty well had it not been left to deteriorate.

name: rusted wakizashi
description: A single-edged rusted blade from a far land. It would've probably been able to cut pretty well had it not been left to deteriorate.

name: rusted zweihander
description: A zweihander that has been left to stand the test of time. While it might not cut as well anymore, it still is quite the hefty weapon.

name: rusted nodachi
description: A large single-edged rusted blade from a far land. It would've probably been able to cut pretty well had it not been left to deteriorate, but is still quite the weapon regardless of its current state.

name: rusted broadsword
description: A broadsword that has a lot of time and weathering to its name, if it ever had a name. Not as useful as when it was new but it's better than nothing.

name: rusted rapier
description: A rapier that looks and feels far too deteriorated to have the right to be called one. Only the desperate would be caught using this in a duel.

name: rusted katana
description: A single-edged rusted blade from a far land. It would've probably been able to cut pretty well had it not been left to deteriorate.

name: rusted butterfly swords
description: Like scarred and disgraced sisters these blades are better off not seen in public with their unsightly rust and unattractive cutting edge.

name: rusted cutlass
description: The sailor that had this blade must've died a long time ago. Or not, the smell of the salty sea can still be picked up on the rusted blade.

name: deteriorated lajatang
description: Not only are both of its blades rusted to hell, this lajatang's shaft has wood rot to its core. Don't expect a lot of use out of this weapon.

name: rusted war flail
description: What once would strike fear into the hearts of armoured units now only makes them laugh at the sorry state of it. Time was not kind to this flail.

name: moldy peasant flail
description: Even the peasants forgot about this one. Without use and care this flail has fallen to wood rot and is much less effective than it once was.

name: deteriorated battleaxe
description: Who knows who this battleaxe once belonged to. A barbarian perhaps? No matter, not even they would use this weapon anymore.

name: moldy bokken
description: What looks like a piece of old curved driftwood was actually once a training sword involving single-edged curved blades without much in the way of guards. Now it's no better than a water-logged stick.

name: moldy cudgel
description: Why would anyone use this as a weapon, one might ask? Because they didn't have a stick.

name: rusted sledge hammer
description: Rusted or not, this hammer is still serviceable. Whether it'll last a day or perhaps two is another question.

name: rusted lucern hammer
description: Rusted or not, this hammer is still serviceable. Whether it'll last a day or perhaps two is another question.

name: rusted mace
description: This mace has been eaten away over time by rust. It's sill usable as a melee weapon but it's definitely not as good as it used to be.

name: rusted morningstar
description: This morningstar has been eaten away over time by rust. It's sill usable as a melee weapon but it's definitely not as good as it used to be, and its spikes aren't really there anymore.

name: moldy quarterstaff
description: Walk around with this and people might think you a wizard or a wise hermit of the forest. That doesn't mean it's a good weapon though.

name: moldy shillelagh
description: A stout knotty stick with a large knot at the top. Well, used to be stout. Wood rot has settled in and it might not last much longer under abuse.

name: moldy tonfa
description: An odd wooden weapon like a short pole with a handle. You'd imagine it'd be effective if the rot hasn't taken hold and made it little better than a branch you can pick up outside

name: rusted war hammer
description: While this hammer may have been used in war once upon a time, it is far from adequate now in its deteriorated and fragile state. Doesn't mean it can't still pack a few more hard hits though.

name: rusted pitchfork
description: A old pitchfork that probably came from a farm long forgotten or retaken by nature. It's not a good weapon by any stretch of the term but it's better than nothing.

name: rusted spear
description: This one was probably used on a battlefield by a line of shield-carrying men long ago. Now it's little more than a flimsy pole with rusted and barely serviceable pointy end.

name: rusted qiang
description: A rusted spear from a far off land. It has a tassle that barely has any colour left.

name: rusted halberd
description: A halberd without much good left to say about it. It may have had a use in the hands of a guard some time ago but it clearly didn't serve them well on that last day, and it won't serve you nearly as well either.

name: rusted glave
description: A very old glave that has seen much better days. They rusted blade is barely holding together and you think the wood is starting to chip away.

name: rusted halberd
description: A halberd without much good left to say about it. It may have had a use in the hands of a guard some time ago but it clearly didn't serve them well on that last day, and it won't serve you nearly as well either.

name: rusted naginata
description: An old polearm with a curved rusted blade from a far off land. Whether it served its master faithfully is irrelevant now.

name: rusted pike
description: A wooden shaft flaking away and tipped with a rusted iron spearhead. It's not gonna last long even under that best combat conditions.
